充斥着大量的GRE GMAT 词汇
根据自己的英文水平谨慎购买
权当我在上英文课了

185546530.review: CRPG. Spiritual successor to Planescape. This game was...just okay. Needed to be more. More interesting, deeper. But it was fine to play, just not as much as hoped for.

185056114.review: I Enjoyed the story but also found it confusing at times and I wish it was voiced to add character. Most of the characters didnt stand out to me and I found them rather forgetful. some of the places you visit are stunning and I loved examining the environments and learning about the lore. I found the upgrade system confusing and tried to avoid combat as much as possible. I just about recommend if you are a fan of CRPGs

185029733.review: This story, despite its pondersome setting, speaks volumes about human nature and does not shy away from describing complex thoughts and relationships.

184869730.review:
Buy it on sale. Something about it just didn't feel right. Almost like it ran out of budget (which most likely happened as this was a Kickstarter). The combat isn't anything special but thankfully most of it can be avoided if you dump most stats into INT. The story starts off pretty strong and just abruptly stops. The last half of the game felt awkward.

 I kept trying to play this game on and off over the last few years and finally decided to finish it. Unlike Planescape: Torment, this is a very mediocre successor. It's not amazing but it isn't terrible either. It's like a slightly overpriced meal that you'd get at a chain place. I went into it excited to dig in and just felt like my food was overcooked. I still had an okay time though.

184795998.review:
There are exquisite moments in this game, fantastic writing and character design. A few moments capture the namesake, but this feels very different from planescape. I would recommend this to anyone who is interested in the setting, enjoys reading lots of text and can tolerate a sprinkle of boring combat.

However, the game is confused, there are many items, skills and abilities that are meant for the least significant part of the game, the combat. This is almost a point and click adventure, but it does not have the narrative polish and pacing of one.

There is a version of this game that is cohesive, continues the polish of the opening scene throughout and made up its mind on whether to have good combat or none at all. But not this version. This version clearly had lots of love, but doesnt fully payoff the promises it sets up.

184212722.review: fantastic crpg with unique alien-like setting, dont let the negative rewievs cloud your judgement about it

183864482.review: Pretentious garbage that doesn't even realize it's supposed to be a game.

183698613.review:
Some mechanics are interesting, but the game feels half-finished. I felt like I was only halfway through the main story when it was actually near the end. More should be done with the Tides. Leveling and progression did not seem very well paced. That said, the story and lore were very entertaining. Decent enough for a a short playthrough if you have a few bucks to spare.

Edit: also very buggy
